author: Staff Reporter
text:
Pattali Makkal Katchi’s founder S. Ramadoss has said that the State government must not appoint candidates to fill the vacant Vice-Chancellor slots in eight universities, including Madras University, across Tamil Nadu.

“There have been reports that corruption and fraud are a part and parcel of these appointments, which are disconcerting. It’s clear that if the rules and regulations of the University Grants Commission are not properly followed, fraud is bound to take place in these appointments,” he said in a statement here on Saturday.

“The State government knows this very well and it is bent on not following the rules. With educationist Mu. Ananthakrishnan already fighting a case in the Madras High Court and the verdict expected in a few days' time, the State government must not fill any spots in the mean time,” he said.

‘Fraud is bound to take place if UGC rules and regulations are not properly followed’
title: Don’t fill up V-C positions before verdict: Ramadoss
